headline: Amazon Plans to Invest $4 Billion by 2026 to Speed Up Deliveries in Rural America
summary: Amazon  said it plans to invest $4 billion to expand its delivery network in small towns across the U.S.  The investment will grow its rural network footprint to over 200 delivery stations, Amazon said on Wednesday.  “While many logistics providers have backed away from investing in rural customers and communities, we’re doing the opposite,” said Udit Madan, Amazon’s senior vice president of worldwide operations, in a press release.

raw.headline: Amazon Plans to Invest $4 Billion by 2026 to Speed Up Deliveries in Rural America

headline: Trump’s temper has CEOs running scared. They’re missing a huge opportunity
summary: America’s CEOs have spent much of second Trump administration cutting million-dollar checks for his inauguration fund, putting out press releases touting their “new” investments in domestic production, and generally keeping quiet about the administration’s defiance of democratic norms. Any pushback against the White House’s trashing of the global economic order has been handled behind closed doors.

headline: Should Investors Worry About Nvidia's Future in China?
summary: Just a few years ago, Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) generated more of its revenue in China than it did in the United States.  U.S. tech giants from Amazon to Meta Platforms ramped up their AI platforms and turned to Nvidia for its top graphics processing units (GPUs) and other products and services.  As a result, Nvidia's total revenue soared, climbing in the double and triple digits quarter after quarter to reach record levels.

raw.headline: Should Investors Worry About Nvidia's Future in China?
raw.summary: Just a few years ago, Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) generated more of its revenue in China than it did in the United States.  U.S. tech giants from Amazon to Meta Platforms ramped up their AI platforms and turned to Nvidia for its top graphics processing units (GPUs) and other products and services.  As a result, Nvidia's total revenue soared, climbing in the double and triple digits quarter after quarter to reach record levels.
